results.doc_title: HelloTech FAQ: HelloTech employee hub in Poland
results.summary: HelloTech is establishing a new employee hub in Wrocław, Poland as part of a cost-reduction strategy. The hub will be staffed through natural attrition to maintain development capacity while reducing costs, with Berlin remaining as HelloTech's headquarters. The move is driven by financial goals to achieve sustainable cost savings that can be reinvested into product development.
key_points: New HelloTech employee hub opening in Wrocław, Poland to reduce Cost to Serve
Roles will be filled through natural attrition, not affecting current employees' roles or responsibilities
Poland employees will follow same 3-day in-office hybrid work policy as other sites
Berlin will continue as HelloTech headquarters
Wrocław chosen for strong talent pool, cost efficiency, location stability, and growth potential
iOS app homepage issue reported and being investigated via Slack
Lokalise translation tasks created and deleted for HelloFresh Homepage Order cards experiment
decisions: Opening new employee hub in Wrocław, Poland
Backfilling roles in Poland through natural attrition
Maintaining 3-day in-office hybrid work policy for Poland hub
Berlin remains as HelloTech HQ
action_items: Line managers should reach out to Juliana de Carvalho Nogueira for open roles or recruitment questions about Poland
Work with Alliance leaders to determine logistical next steps for Poland recruitment
iOS app homepage issue being investigated in Slack channel C0A3ESS0SEB
Leaders may need to travel between locations for hybrid team-building activities

results.summary: This is a handover document for Alexander Matlin's vacation coverage from December 31, 2025 to January 11, 2026. It outlines four ongoing projects with their current status, assigned owners, and pending actions. All items are currently in 'To Do' status and require attention during the vacation period.
key_points: Charge at Checkout experiment was stopped on Dec 29, 2025 due to Statsig health issues and 8% error rate in 500 errors
OTP project needs ticket updates to reflect new approach using OTP API endpoint instead of reactivation flow
Three internal candidates are pending approval for Good Chop hiring positions (Senior Frontend, Frontend, and Senior Backend Engineer)
New York expenses are awaiting approval from Daniel Arias
decisions: Charge at Checkout experiment allocation was stopped on Dec 29, 2025
OTP approach changed to use OTP API endpoint instead of reactivation flow
action_items: Beatrice Dimarucut to escalate Charge at Checkout issues to Daniel Arias or Nikita Gorshkov if needed
Experimentation Core team to start investigation on Jan 7, 2025 when developer returns from vacation
Beatrice Dimarucut to ask Himash Tehan to update OTP tickets
Daniel Arias to get approval from Holger Hammel for three hiring positions and officially open them
Daniel Arias to approve New York expenses

results.doc_title: LEGO: Unified Prospects Checkout Features and Layout for Meal Brands
results.summary: LEGO is an initiative to create a unified prospects checkout experience across all HelloFresh Group meal brands (HelloFresh, GreenChef, EveryPlate, ChefsPlate, Factor, and Youfoodz). The project involves refactoring checkout into modular, reusable features to reduce code duplication across 31 distinct codebases and improve development velocity. As of the document date, most core features have been rolled out, with the unified layout implementation in progress for H1-2025.
key_points: HelloFresh Group operates 8 brands across 18 countries with 31 distinct checkout codebases that need standardization
Checkout ownership was transferred to Growth Alliance in January 2025 to centralize management
Core checkout features (Order Summary, Register Form, Address Form, Delivery Details, Payment Methods) are being modularized and unified across brands
Most features have been successfully rolled out to HelloFresh and RTE/WLMK brands, with some experiments still in progress
The unified 'Lego Checkout' layout has been rolled out across brands
2025 objective is to accelerate product development velocity for RTE brands by distributing ownership across consumer-facing alliances
decisions: Social Logins Feature showed neutral results for RTE/WLMK brands and will not be rolled out
Delivery Details Feature showed neutral results for RTE/WLMK mobile
Register Form Feature experiment to be re-launched for HelloFresh
Rollout decision for US experiment to be made mid-March
action_items: UFI-9680: Integrate with New Progress bar (Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025)
UFI-9678: Remove invalid voucher before making OPS call/query params (Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025)
UFI-9682: Add check for logged-in user/cart-id and redirect (Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025)
UFI-9686: Add lego-checkout applanga group for caching (Completed)
UFI-9693: Check requirement for CTA sticky-ness (Not Started)
@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com to add tickets for items to be moved to Features
@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com to consider layout work requirements in broken down tickets
@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com to add a spike
@harneet.singh@hellofresh.com to provide status update

results.doc_title: LEGO: Unified Prospects Checkout Features and Layout for Meal Brands
results.summary: LEGO is an initiative to create a unified prospects checkout experience across all HelloFresh Group meal brands (HelloFresh, GreenChef, EveryPlate, ChefsPlate, Factor, and Youfoodz). The project involves refactoring checkout into modular, reusable features to reduce development effort and enable centralized management of 31 distinct codebases across 8 brands and 18 countries. The goal for H1-2025 is to complete feature modularization and unify checkout layouts for all meal brands.
key_points: Unified checkout will work across all Mealkit brands (HelloFresh, GreenChef, EveryPlate, ChefsPlate) and RTE brands (Factor, Youfoodz)
Checkout ownership transferred from TAM Alliance to Growth Alliance in January 2025, expanding scope to 31 distinct codes
Most checkout features (Order Summary, Register Form, Address Form, Delivery Details, Payment Methods) have been rolled out across brands
Unified Layout (Lego Checkout) has been rolled out for HelloFresh and other brands
Initiative aims to accelerate product development velocity and reduce isolated work efforts across brands
Social Logins Feature showed neutral results for RTE/WLMK brands with no rollout planned
NV (accounting for ~$250M annual revenue) was not included in original scope but could potentially adopt Lego with additional work
decisions: Social Logins Feature will not be rolled out to RTE/WLMK brands due to neutral experiment results
Rollout decision for US experiment to be made mid-March
Delivery Details Feature showed neutral results for RTE/WLMK mobile rollout
action_items: UFI-9680: Integrate with New Progress bar (Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025)
UFI-9678: Remove invalid voucher before making OPS call/query params (Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025)
UFI-9682: Add check for logged-in user/cart-id and redirect (Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025)
UFI-9686: Add lego-checkout applanga group for caching (Completed)
UFI-9693: Check requirement for CTA sticky-ness (Not Started)

results.doc_title: LEGO: Unified Prospects Checkout Features and Layout for Meal Brands
results.summary: LEGO is an initiative to create a unified prospects checkout experience across all HelloFresh Group meal brands (HelloFresh, GreenChef, EveryPlate, ChefsPlate, Factor, and Youfoodz). The project involves refactoring checkout into modular, reusable features to reduce code duplication across 31 distinct codebases and improve development velocity. The goal for H1-2025 is to complete feature modularization and unify checkout layouts for all meal brands.
key_points: HelloFresh Group operates 8 brands across 18 countries with 31 distinct checkout codebases to manage
Checkout ownership was transferred from TAM Alliance to Growth Alliance in January 2025 to centralize management
Most checkout features (Order Summary, Register Form, Address Form, Delivery Details, Payment Methods) have been rolled out across brands
The unified layout (Lego Checkout) has been rolled out for HelloFresh, RTE, and New Mealkits brands
Initiative aims to accelerate product development velocity and ensure consistency across brands by using shared, reusable components
NV brand (accounting for ~$250M annual revenue) was not included in original scope but may need integration
decisions: Social Logins Feature showed neutral results for RTE/WLMK brands and will not be rolled out
Delivery Details Feature showed neutral results for RTE/WLMK mobile
Rollout decision for US experiment to be made mid-March
Growth Alliance now owns checkout for all brands except GoodChop and Pets Table (remaining with TAM)
action_items: Complete feature modularization and unify layouts for all meal brands by H1-2025
Re-launch Register Form Feature experiment for HelloFresh
Re-launch Social Logins Feature experiment for HelloFresh

results.doc_title: IXI Results: Creator Marketplace Customer Interviews
results.summary: Research participants responded positively to HelloFresh's Influencer Marketplace concept, which addresses friction points in sourcing niche ingredients and managing saved recipes. However, trust is driven by practical signals rather than influencer status, with users expecting HelloFresh to vet recipes or provide transparent community ratings. The marketplace is viewed as an occasion-based solution favoring one-time purchases over subscriptions, with food-first discovery preferred over creator-led browsing.
key_points: Concept addresses two major pain points: difficulty sourcing niche ingredients and forgotten saved recipes
Trust driven by practical signals (visuals, instructions, verification) rather than influencer status alone
Users expect HelloFresh to ensure recipe quality through testing/approval or transparent community ratings
Marketplace perceived as occasion-based (weekends, hosting, dinner) rather than everyday meal planning
Strong preference for one-time purchases over subscription requirements to lower barrier to trial
Discovery should be food-first (ingredient/cuisine search) rather than creator-led
Need for robust recipe management tools including custom organization and scheduling features
Participants skeptical about unverified creator recipes without HelloFresh vetting
decisions: Include direct links to original social media videos on recipe pages (supported by 4 out of 8 participants)
Implement verified badge system for HelloFresh-tested recipes
Create unfiltered review system with ratings, feedback, and photos
Add recipe comments or Q&A section separate from reviews
Avoid forced subscription model as it creates financial and psychological barriers
action_items: Forward idea to DAU team (mentioned by katheryn.eckles)
Implement digital curation/personalization to address recipe engagement issues
Consider clean-up process for recipes with no engagement over time

Create video clips documenting: sentiment/reactions, main barriers to cooking influencer recipes, trust mechanisms, usage scenarios, subscription expectations, navigation preferences, and saved recipe features

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Company conducting research on Influencer/Creator Marketplace concept; expected to vet recipes and ensure quality

entities.name: Influencer Marketplace / Creator Marketplace
entities.context: New concept being researched to allow users to purchase recipes from social media influencers with ingredient delivery
